When I read all the negative reviews, I thought: "Hey, this can't be [i]this[/i] bad. It's a Half-Life game after all."

I was so, so wrong.

I'll start with the length - 2 hours and 40 minutes of gameplay. Ok, not bad for a expansion pack. Shame that Opposing Force is a lot longer and costs the same amount of money.

Enemies jumping out at you are too predictable. They are more of a obstacle than a challenge here.

When I enter a new area I think: "Why am I here?" or "What's the point of this?" instead of "Wow, this is really cool."

Then there's the difficulty and health management - or rather the lack of it. Here, I run around with 100 hp and 50 armour on my first playthrough and 50%-100% ammo to all guns instead of the usual, average 70% health and no armour and striving to find more ammo. Here, Ammunition is just there for the sake od it. It's not a life-saver like in the original game. Same applies to health & armour stations/kits.

The Hazard Course is not new. They literally took the identical thing from Half-Life and replaced the hologram. Where you originally first see a HEV charger, the pedastal with the arrow is still there as if they didn't even bother removing it.

The only actually interesting thing is the level design of some stages, especially the Xen chapter, which is really cool, and you get to see new stuff.

Oh, I almost forgot. This has [b] no new content[/b]. That's right. No new enemies or weapons here.

Blue Shift is a second and last expansion pack of Half-Life by Gearbox. This time it only has single-player campaign, there is no multiplayer component. If you want to play some Deathmatch, you should better head toward HL1. It also came with HD models bundled in Retail, and so in Steam version too.

Now, the single player campaign is quite short and doesn't include any kind of new features, whetever weapons or enemeis. And that may dissapoint you when compared to first expansion pack. The reason for it being this way - it wasn't made to be a full expansion pack. Instead, it's origin was to be a bonus content for Dreamcast version of HL1. Shame that it was cancelled when it was almost done. So, not to lose work that been done, Gearbox released it for PC serapately. Another thing you might notice is that it reuses Opposing Force (the first expansion pack) soundtrack

In this campaign you are Barney Calhoun, the random security guard, who owes Gordon a beer. And unlike every other security guards, he actually passed advanced movement training and can navigate doorways just fine. And stairs. And vents. And shoots many crabs. And he is no hero and his only wish is not to stop alien invasion, but just to get the hell out of here. Ok, he, like a proper hero, has to get the surviving personel out of facility into outside safety.  So, you are back into usual Half-Life busyness, shooting, solving "puzzles" and exlporing levels, with fair share of plot conversations with scienists. All while getting to use realistical only weapons (no Gauss Gun fun), with ammo somewhat limited for each one.There is no real climax final boss, the ending seem to be a bunch of strange teasers, so to say. Otherwise it should be pleasent and make sense. I could say, it's the least repetive experience compared to HL1 and OpForce, maybe it just ends before it gets stale.

But yes, it would have made nice bonus content for Dreamcast, but lacking expansion pack. At least it came packing with HD models and Opposing Force on retail in some regions. Some even say that it contains leftover Dreamcast version codes inside cue some dissapearing corpses. Though, HL1 and OpposingForce on Steam had them as well, strange. Another strange thing is that none the soldiers here ever threw normal grenades at me, they would just place down grenade and run when heavily wounded. And most curiously, it uses soundtrack of Opposing Force... Which doesn't feel right. Cheerful military drumbs beat when the security guard falls to his demise due to two zombies? As looking at the footage of Dreamcast version (it leaked to Internet, yes) it's supposed to use Half-Life soundtrack instead.

Recomendo para os fans da saga Half Life. É interessante ser jogado pois mostra os acontecimentos em Black Mesa de uma perspectiva diferente, na pele de Barney Calhoun, um guarda da Black Mesa.
Logo no início do jogo é possível ver Gordon Freeman e Gina Cross (de Half Life Decay) pelas câmeras de segurança.
Em vários momentos o jogador se depara com os mesmos lugares e/ou acontecimentos vistos em Half Life e Half Life Opposing Force.
A campanha de Blue Shift é mais curta que as de Half Life e HL Opposing Force.

Nach Opposing Force ist Blue Shift die zweite Erweiterung zu Half Life. In Blue Shift übernimmt der Spieler die Rolle von Barney Calhoun,einem Sicherheitsmann der Black Mesa und muss sich nach dem schiefgelaufenem Experiment aus der Anlage retten.
Spielerisch biete diese Erweiterung leider keine nennenswerten Neuheiten und auch die Spielzeit ist relativ kurz gehalten. Zwar ist der Ablauf der Ereignisse in Black Mesa aus der Sicht mehrerer Beteiligter durchaus interessant, doch leider recht ausgereizt. Ich erinnere mich noch an ein Videospielmagazin(ich glaube es war die Gamestar),die witzelte ob man das nächste Addon dann aus der Sicht der Putzfrau spielen würde. Blue Shift ist nicht direkt schlecht und hat keine großen Macken,es mangelt einfach am Umfang.
Ein Pluspunkt bot damals(2001)lediglich das „High Definition Pack“,welches mit dem Spiel angeboten wurde und einige Texturen verbessert. Allerdings gilt das für die damalige Verkaufsversion. Soweit ich in Erfahrung bringen kann ist dieses Feature mittlerweile optional für die Half Life Spiele verfügbar.
Alles in allem ist Blue Shift kein Pflichttitel und definitiv der schwächste Teil der Ur-Half Life's.
Wer sich davon nicht abschrecken lässt bekommt zwar kurze,jedoch solide Kost im typischen Half Life Stil geboten.

Die Soldaten in Blue Shift sind in der Deutschen Version abermals zu Robotern geworden und Blut- sowie Splattereffekte wurden entfernt. Auch die Wissenschaftler und Wachmänner setzen sich bei Beschuss wieder brav hin und schütteln den Kopf um ihr Trübsal kundzutun.
Glücklicherweise gibt es eine Möglichkeit,diese Änderungen rückgängig zu machen. Wer die „unmodifizierte“ Version spielen möchte, der sollte sich diesen Guide mal näher anschauen. Hat einwandfrei funktioniert!

If you like the original Half Life, you'll also like Blue Shift.  It's a very similar game, with the same type of action and puzzles (and even the same weapons).  Many of the same enemies return as well, both from Xen and Marines.  If you haven't played the original Half Life, I'd recommend starting there instead.  Both have excellent gameplay, but you get more of the story in the original.

I'd recommend Opposing Force over Blue Shift, however.  Both are the same price, but Opposing Force is about twice as long, and is also a much more innovative expansion, with interesting new weapons and levels that differ more from the original than Blue Shift's.  Blue Shift itsn't bad by any means, it just doesn't add new content to the series in the way Opposing Force does.

Half-Life: Blue Shift — это второе дополнение для шутера от первого лица Half-Life, разработанное компанией Gearbox Software и выпущенное 12 июня 2001 года. Как и другие дополнения от Gearbox, Half-Life: Opposing Force и Half-Life: Decay, Blue Shift изображает события, произошедшие в Half-Life, но c точки зрения другого персонажа: охранника «Чёрной Мезы» — Барни Калхауна. В роли Барни, игрок должен попытаться сбежать из секретной лаборатории, захваченной пришельцами из другого мира и отрядами HECU.

В отличие от первого дополнения Opposing Force, Half-Life: Blue Shift является автономным аддоном и не требует установленной на компьютере оригинальной версии Half-Life. Во время установки Blue Shift предлагает пользователю установить особый пакет улучшения графики «Half-Life High Definition Pack», включающий в себя обновлённые модели персонажей и оружия. Американский релиз Blue Shift также включает полную версию Opposing Force. Интернациональная версия предлагает только мультиплеерную версию Opposing Force: Capture the Flag.

Сторонними разработчиками осуществлялся перенос Blue Shift на движок Source, но он до сих пор не завершён. Проект носит название «Guard Duty».[4]

Half-Life: Blue Shift is the second single player expansion of Valve's Half-Life and is arguably weaker than the first expansion pack, Opposing Force. 

The campaign puts players in the role of Barney Calhoun, one of the security guards at the Black Mesa Research Facility. Soon after Calhoun starts a typical shift, aliens begin invading the research base and chaos ensues. 

Gameplay is identical to the original Half-Life with no tweaks or changes that were seen in Opposing Force. The campaign is also much shorter and can be completed in one short playthrough. 

Fans of the series will no doubt enjoy another trip to Black Mesa but for the uninitiated they may find Blue Shift a disappointingly short experience.

Nesse jogo agora você joga como Calhoun é tem uma visão de como a historia se liga (O experimento feito por Freeman e a "invasão alienigena" em Black Mesa.)Além de em algumas partes do jogo você vêr o Freeman,exemplo no começo do jogo na qual você está na porta esperando o guarda abrir e Freeman passa pelo trem assim como ocorreu no Half Life na qual você vê um guarda batendo na porta que nesse jogo percebemos que se trata de Calhoun.Além de vêr Freeman em uma parte do jogo você escuta uma conversa de dois marines enquanto jogam corpos de mortos no esgoto na qual um marine claramente menciona o nome de Shephard (O cabo no qual você incorporou no Opposing Force) deixando claro que ambas historias ocorrem no mesmo lugar só mudando de local e hora do acontecimento.

Half Life Blue Shift não apresenta nenhuma nova arma ou inimigo,na minha opinião foi mais um jogo para mostrar o quão a historia é importante e está ligada do que um jogo para passar horas e horas matando inimigos e realizando desafios (puzzles).Porém isso não o torna um jogo ruim ou mal feito ele é apenas mais curto que queria mostrar que outras pessoas de Black Mesa conseguiram sobreviver e como fizeram isso.

Vale a pena lembrar que Half Life Blue Shift assim como Opposing Force são expansões ou complementos para historia de Half Life mostrando a visão de outros personagens que estiveram em Black Mesa durante o acontecimento portanto podem ser jogos que não agradem o publico em geral mas sem duvidas ira agradar quem quiser saber mais sobre a historia que se passa no mundo de half life.

For my opinion on Half-Life as a whole and it's expansions, go and read my Half-Life or even my Opposing Force review so that I don't have to repeat it here. It was Game of the Year back then for a reason and to me it will ALWAYS be one of the all-time greats in gaming. 

I don't feel that there is a bad extension to Half-Life, the vast multiplayer extensions and Opposing Force, and yes, even Blue Shift are worth their weight in gold. 

Blue Shift has received quite a bit of flack from the gaming community and the Half-Life fan base, and I can understand why it's not as popular as Half-Life itself or Opposing Force, but it really isn't deserving of a lot of the criticism it receives. The only real fault with the game is that it is incredibly short, so I don't feel it's worth it's full retail price, best to pick it up for cheap during a sale, but I still think it's a must-have for any Half-Life fan. This small expansion requires you to think before you make an action and to use your ammunition/armour wisely.

It is questionable as to whether this game is canon to the entire series, some say yes and some say no, but that doesn't really matter, the point is that it is another way to experience Half-Life through a different perspective, that of a Black Mesa Security Guard - Barny Calhoun. 
As already mentioned, the game is short, VERY short, so you won't be playing for long, but it is still fun. There are no new weapons or enemies, I'm afraid, but if you have ever played Decay, this is a great storyline to experience as it goes along with that story extremely well (again, Valve proves their story-telling genius).

I don't really have much else to say, so to sum it up in a few words: This game is, in my opinion, worth getting despite the flack it has received, but not at it's full retail price (unless you're loaded). You can not have Half-Life without Opposing Force and Blue Shift. Just remember - It's short and you won't be in-game for long, so don't be disappointed when you reach the end much sooner than you may think.

Half Life: Blue Shift es la segunda expansión del aclamado juego ''Half Life''. La expansión te pone en la piel del agente de seguridad Barney Calhoun, quien intentara desesperadamente escapar de las instalaciones de Black Mesa intentado ayudar a todo aquél que pueda. La premisa es completamente lo contrario que lo planteado en ''Half Life: Opposing Force''. El juego nos plantea un punto de vista diferente del accidente de Black Mesa poniéndonos en un lado neutral en la historia en vez de ser el héroe o el villano. Es una buena expansión, bastante divertida que da nuevos detalles de la historia sin profundizar en esta. El juego tiene menos variedad de armas que ''Half Life: Opposing Force'', pero esto más allá de ser malo a mi parecer te hace sentir más como un agente de seguridad que va más desprotegido que un soldado. Aún y así a nivel jugable se podría decir que es una pega. Otro punto negativo tiene es lo corto que es, más que la anterior expansión. Aparte no sé porque motivo no deja poner el juego en español cuando según me he informado si que existe una traducción al español. 

En resumen, una divertida expansión que da más de lo mismo pero que consigue enganchar una vez más.

Jedná se o druhý datadisk ke hře [url=http://store.steampowered.com/app/70/]Half-Life[/url]. Vaše jméno je Barney Calhoun, a pracujete jako člen ochranky, ve výzkumném komplexu Black Mesa. Po příjezdu do práce zjišťujete, že se vaši kolegové již potýkají s drobnými poruchami. Nezdá se ale, že by se mělo jednat o něco závažného, prostě jen náhodná souhra okolností. Následující události, vás ale brzy vyvedou z omylu...

Blue Shift původně neměl na počítače vůbec vyjít. Byl vytvořen jako exkluzivní bonus pro hráče, kteří si zakoupí Half-Life pro konzoli Dreamcast. Z toho nakonec sešlo, a tak bylo rozhodnuto, že tento bonus bude vydán jako datadisk. Že se nejedná o plnohodnotné rozšíření, je na této hře ovšem velice znát.

Nejenže tento datadisk nepřináší nic nového, on dokonce obsahuje jen část z toho, co jste mohli najít už v původní hře. Dočkáte se tak pouze klasických zbraní, takže na ty mimozemské můžete zapomenout. Vyřazeni byli také někteří nepřátelé, a na jejich místo, žádní noví nepřišli.

Největší slabinou tohoto přídavku, jsou ale špatně navržené lokace. Velká část hry se odehrává v dlouhých chodbách a tunelech, které nic zajímavého nenabízejí. Tedy pokud nemáte zálibu v rozbíjení beden, protože těch je všude plno.

Nepovedeným dojmem působí také prostornější místa, na kterých se odehrává většina přestřelek s vojáky. Jejich chování je vynikající, pokud se bojuje v členitém prostoru, toho se jim zde ale nedostává. Často se tak opakovala situace, kdy se voják rozhodl přemístit, ale jediné vhodné místo, bylo několik desítek metrů za ním. Otočil se proto zády ke mně, a dal se na zběsilý úprk. Z přestřelek se tak pravidelně stával nudný hon na zajíce.

Tento datadisk proto můžu doporučit jen těm, kteří musejí vědět, co Barney prožíval v komplexu Black Mesa. Vy ostatní, tento přídavek raději vynechte.
